title: (x) Starbucks - various {gang}
content:
i'm looking for some good block-type fonts, such as the one used in the [Starbucks](http://web.archive.org/web/20150320042044/http:/www-ccs.cs.umass.edu/~cris/pix/2898/spaceneedle-starbucks-067.3.jpeg) logo.   
   
and also, the font used on the new Fall Out Boy CD, [Take This To Your Grave](http://web.archive.org/web/20150320042044/http:/www.interpunk.com/itemimages2/23899.jpg), is pretty close also.   
   
any help you guys could give me on those two, or any good block kinda fonts (preferably free!) would be awesome.
author: anonymous

comments.content:
Ryan ... you needed to click a bit to get to the heavier weights.   
   
 [http://www.typography.com/catalog/knockout/series\_g.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150320042044/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/knockout/series_g.html)   
   
I was under the impression that Starbucks   
was set in Franklin Gothic, but I haven't   
confirmed it.   
   
bj
Futura Extra Bold, Gill Sans Extra Bold, Avenir Black, TheSans black, Today Ultra are all good choices. I am too lazy to provide links for all of them.

I always thought [ITC Stone Sans Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20150320042044/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-stone-sans-2/stone-sans-itc-bold/testdrive.html?s=STARBUCKS%2BCOFFEE&p=48) was a better approximation of the Starbucks Logo font (which I think is a custom font). The other suggestions are fine for the CD lettering, because it's a different font.

hmm... i need something more thick than those...   
like a basic thick font that i wouldnt have to manipulate much to get this overall feel...   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150320042044im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/41536.jpg)   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150320042044im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/41537.jpg)   
   
any other help?

I dont know exactly what you are looking for but anyway I think the knockout series are really versatile.   
   
 [http://www.typography.com/catalog/knockout/series\_a.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150320042044/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/knockout/series_a.html)   
   
You could also try some of the Font Bureau sans, like Bureau Grotesque, Rhode, Nobel, Berlin Sans and the famous Eagle.
